results.title: Dave's story
results.brief_description: In this short monologue the narrator reveals a crucial moment in his young life - when his high school teacher revealed the secret to happiness. Made as part of the ‘Pride and Diversity’ workshop in association with Vic Health.
results.description: In this short monologue the narrator reveals a crucial moment in his young life - when his high school teacher revealed the secret to happiness. Made as part of the ‘Pride and Diversity’ workshop in association with Vic Health.

results.title: The Descent
results.creator_credit: Andrew Schultz, John Bird, David Atkinson, Film Victoria and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A claymation (influenced by Jan Svankmejer in sepia tones and use of stop-still animated found objects and cut-tin figurines) depicts a storm ravaged landscape of an empire. The ruling giant, ‘metal’ Queen summons her miniature servants to find and rescue her giant clay King. Like ants the small servants work together to unite the King and Queen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew Schultz, John Bird, David Atkinson, Film Victoria and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.description: A claymation (influenced by Jan Svankmejer in sepia tones and use of stop-still animated found objects and cut-tin figurines) depicts a storm ravaged landscape of an empire. The ruling giant, ‘metal’ Queen summons her miniature servants to find and rescue her giant clay King. Like ants the small servants work together to unite the King and Queen.
description_for_label: A claymation (influenced by Jan Svankmejer in sepia tones and use of stop-still animated found objects and cut-tin figurines) depicts a storm ravaged landscape of an empire. The ruling giant, ‘metal’ Queen summons her miniature servants to find and rescue her giant clay King. Like ants the small servants work together to unite the King and Queen.

results.title: Paper War
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Guan Wei
results.brief_description: This simple tracking shot along Guan Wei’s exquisitely drawn battle scenes, silhouetted against a traditional landscape scroll, suggests the right-to-left movement of Chinese reading.
results.description: This simple tracking shot along Guan Wei’s exquisitely drawn battle scenes, silhouetted against a traditional landscape scroll, suggests the right-to-left movement of Chinese reading.

results.title: A 30 second portrait, starring Phil Lombardo
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Cherine Fahd
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Cherine Fahd’s loving and gently funny video portrait of Phil Lombardo, a young man obsessed with Michael Jackson, continues her visual investigation into the politics of personal identity.
results.description: Cherine Fahd’s loving and gently funny video portrait of Phil Lombardo, a young man obsessed with Michael Jackson, continues her visual investigation into the politics of personal identity.
description_for_label: Cherine Fahd’s loving and gently funny video portrait of Phil Lombardo, a young man obsessed with Michael Jackson, continues her visual investigation into the politics of personal identity.

results.title: The Day Before I Went Away
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Guo Jian
results.brief_description: Guo Jian’s saucy and sinister reappropriation of Chinese propaganda painting techniques is heightened by this animation of his allegorical work ‘The Day Before I Went Away’.

results.title: From the heart
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Hossein Valamanesh
results.brief_description: Using 35mm footage capturing his own angiogram, Hossein Valamanesh creates a mysterious, luminescent universe which hovers, like a heartbeat, between biology and the sublime.
results.description: Using 35mm footage capturing his own angiogram, Hossein Valamanesh creates a mysterious, luminescent universe which hovers, like a heartbeat, between biology and the sublime.

results.title: Train No. 6
results.creator_credit: ACMI, SBS Independent and Daniel Crooks
results.brief_description: Using Melbourne’s urban landscape, ‘Train No.6’ extends Crooks’ exploration of his ‘TimeSlice’ technique. A simple train is reconfigured across time to form mesmerising polyocular images.
results.description: Using Melbourne’s urban landscape, ‘Train No.6’ extends Crooks’ exploration of his ‘TimeSlice’ technique. A simple train is reconfigured across time to form mesmerising polyocular images.

results.brief_description: Continuing from his ‘Truth Effect’ series, and the tradition of George MÃ©liÃ¨s, Daniel von Sturmer creates a miniature environment in which an everyday object behaves in unexpected ways.

results.title: Knit-face
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Janet Merewether
results.brief_description: Janet Merewether’s comic portrait series of knitted dolls illuminates the unpredictable, shabby beauty of found objects and gleefully appreciates the individual, creative application of this traditional craft form.
